alert.note: Alert for Caddo; Comanche; Grady; McClain; Stephens (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 2:15AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Comanche, Grady, southeastern Caddo, northwestern Stephens and southwestern McClain Counties through 300 AM CDT... At 215 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cement to near Sterling to 9 miles south of Elgin. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northeastern Lawton, Chickasha, Blanchard, Marlow, Elgin, Apache, Rush Springs, Fletcher, Cyril, Dibble, Sterling, Alex, Cement, Amber, Norge, Bradley, Tabler, Agawam, Middleberg and eastern Fort Sill. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 54 and 95. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
